bitfield.name: BUFFER_INTERLEAVING
bitfield.brief: Supports interleaving depth and color buffers

bitfield.name: YUY2_RENDER_TARGET
bitfield.brief: YUY2 support in PE and YUY2 to RGB conversion in resolve

bitfield.name: 32_BIT_INDICES
bitfield.brief: 32 bit indices can be used with indexed drawing

bitfield.name: FLIP_Y
bitfield.brief: Y flipping capability is added to resolve

bitfield.name: DUAL_RETURN_BUS
bitfield.brief: Dual Return Bus from HI to clients

bitfield.name: SPECIAL_MSAA_LOD
bitfield.brief: Special LOD calculation when MSAA is on

bitfield.name: FAST_CLEAR_FLUSH
bitfield.brief: Proper flush is done in fast clear cache

bitfield.name: 2BITPERTILE
bitfield.brief: Two status bits per tile (instead of four)

bitfield.name: SEPARATE_TILE_STATUS_WHEN_INTERLEAVED
bitfield.brief: Use 2 separate tile status buffers in interleaved mode

bitfield.name: VG_20
bitfield.brief: Major updates to VG pipe (TS buffer tiling, state masking)

bitfield.name: TS_EXTENDED_COMMANDS
bitfield.brief: New commands added to the VG tessellator

bitfield.name: HAS_SIGN_FLOOR_CEIL
bitfield.brief: Has SIGN, FLOOR and CEIL shader instructions

bitfield.name: VG_21
bitfield.brief: Minor updates to VG pipe (Event generation from VG, TS, PE, tiled image support)

bitfield.name: SHADER_HAS_W
bitfield.brief: W is sent to SH from RA

bitfield.name: MORE_MINOR_FEATURES
bitfield.doc: Also, in the shader unavailable registers will return 0

bitfield.name: MC20
bitfield.brief: New style MC with separate paths for color and depth

bitfield.name: MSAA_SIDEBAND
bitfield.brief: Put the MSAA data into sideband fifo

bitfield.name: BYPASS_IN_MSAA
bitfield.brief: Shader supports bypass mode when MSAA is enabled

bitfield.name: CORRECT_STENCIL
bitfield.brief: Correct stencil behavior in depth only

bitfield.name: VG_DOUBLE_BUFFER
bitfield.brief: Double buffering support for VG (second TS-->VG semaphore is present)

bitfield.name: TEXTURE_STRIDE
bitfield.brief: Texture has stride and memory addressing

bitfield.name: TEXTURE_ALIGN_4
bitfield.brief: Textures can be aligned to 4 instead of 16

bitfield.name: TEXTURE_ARRAY
bitfield.brief: 16 attr per vertex i.s.o. 10, and 12 varyings i.s.o. 8

bitfield.name: TEXTURE_TILED_READ
bitfield.brief: Tiled read also available with COMPOSITION

stripe.name: HI
stripe.doc: Host interface contains bits to identify the chip, control clock speed, and enable/acknowledge interrupts.

reg32.name: IDLE_STATE
reg32.doc: Bits are 1 if the module is idle, 0 otherwise.

bitfield.name: AXI_LOW_POWER
bitfield.brief: AXI bus in low power mode

reg32.name: PROFILE_WRITE_BURSTS
reg32.brief: Total write Data Count in terms of 64bits value

reg32.name: PROFILE_READ_BURSTS
reg32.brief: Total Read Data Count in terms of 64bits

reg32.name: GP_OUT0
reg32.brief: General Purpose output register0. R/W but not connected to anywhere

reg32.name: GP_OUT1
reg32.brief: General Purpose output register1. R/W but not connected to anywhere

reg32.name: GP_OUT2
reg32.brief: General Purpose output register2. R/W but not connected to anywhere

reg32.name: PROFILE_TOTAL_CYCLES
reg32.doc: This register is a free running counter. It can be reset by writing 0 to it.

reg32.name: PROFILE_IDLE_CYCLES
reg32.brief: Total cycles where the GPU is idle
reg32.doc: It is reset when PROFILE_TOTAL_CYCLES register is written to. It looks at all the blocks but FE when determining the IP is idle.

stripe.name: PM
stripe.doc: Features to control power usage.

stripe.name: MMUv2
stripe.doc: New MMU unit. Only exists on some new hardware.

stripe.name: FE
stripe.doc: DMA engine. This is the frontend from the CPU to the GPU, and takes care of parsing the command stream and loading states, as well as loading vertex streams.

bitfield.name: NONCONSECUTIVE
bitfield.brief: Enable when this is not consecutive to previous element, or it is the last element

reg32.name: COMMAND_ADDRESS
reg32.brief: Base address for the command buffer
reg32.doc: The address must be 64-bit aligned and it is always physical. This register cannot be read.

bitfield.name: PREFETCH
bitfield.brief: Number of 64-bit words to fetch from the command buffer

stripe.name: GLOBAL
stripe.doc: Global states
Global device control states. Here is configured what pipe to use (2D or 3D), when to send event, when to wait on semaphores and the API mode (OGL or D3D).

reg32.name: SEMAPHORE_TOKEN
reg32.brief: A sempahore state arms the semaphore in the destination

reg32.name: FLUSH_MMU
reg32.brief: Flush the virtual addrses lookup cache inside the MC

bitfield.name: FLUSH_FEMMU
bitfield.brief: Flush the FE address translation caches

bitfield.name: FLUSH_PEMMU
bitfield.brief: Flush the PE render target address translation caches

reg32.name: PS_VARYING_COMPONENT_USE
reg32.doc: 2 bits per varying component, 16 components per 32-bit word.

stripe.name: DE
stripe.doc: 2D Drawing Engine
2D drawing engine: conversion, scaling, filtering, rotation, blending of 2D images.

reg32.name: SOURCE_BG_COLOR
reg32.brief: Source background color / color key low

reg32.name: SOURCE_UV_SWIZ_MODE
reg32.brief: Source UV swizzle and YUV mode

reg32.name: BLIT_TYPE_2
reg32.brief: Blit type one pass kernel size

stripe.name: VS
stripe.doc: Vertex shader states
The vertex shader to use is configured here.

stripe.name: THREAD_WALKER
stripe.doc: Thread walker states
The thread walker drives shaders in a predefined grid for GPGPU computing (OpenCL). This states are not used for normal rendering.

reg32.name: KICKER
reg32.doc: Write 0xBADABEEB (or 0xBEEBBEEB, unknown if the value matters) to this register to kick off thread walker

stripe.name: PA
stripe.doc: Primitive assembly states
Primitive assembly assembles primitives (tris, quads, lines, points etc) from vertices for 3D rendering. Viewport scaling, line width and point size is configured here.

reg32.name: CONFIG
reg32.doc: These can be set either per group of bits, or all at once, by using masking flags. Each group of state flags has a masking flag that prevents overwriting the flags in that group.

value.name: CW
value.brief: Orientation of front-facing polygons is clockwise

value.name: CCW
value.brief: Orientatino of front-facing polygons is counter-clockwise

stripe.name: SE
stripe.doc: Setup Engine states
The setup engine takes care of scissor, clipping, and depth scale.

stripe.name: RA
stripe.doc: Raster states
Configuration for the rasterizer. This mainly controls multisampling.

stripe.name: PS
stripe.doc: Pixel Shader states
The Pixel (Fragment) shader to use is configured here

reg32.name: OUTPUT_REG
reg32.brief: Register that will contain output color

stripe.name: PE
stripe.doc: Pixel Engine states

The Pixel Engine takes care of fragment (pixel) processing.
Some flags can be set either per group of bits, or all at once, by using masking flags. Each group of state flags has a masking flag that prevents overwriting the flags in that group. These will be called FOO_MASK if the state to be masked is called FOO.

bitfield.name: UNK16
bitfield.brief: Set when alpha blending enabled or otherwise not the full destination is written

stripe.name: COMPOSE
stripe.doc: Compose states

Hardware composer. This functionality is present on some GCxxxx chips and allows for blending surfaces together with Porter-Diff composition methods, to accelerate the likes of Surfaceflinger (Android).

stripe.name: RS
stripe.doc: Resolve states
To my current understanding, RESOLVE is a post-rendering pass, a copy engine that copies the render result from the internal framebuffer to main memory. It can also be used for clearing surfaces.

reg32.name: KICKER
reg32.doc: Write 0xBADABEEB (or 0xBEEBBEEB, unknown if the value matters) to this register to kick off resolver

stripe.name: TS
stripe.doc: Tile Status
Tile status block contains information about the tiles to be resolved.

bitfield.name: DEPTH_AUTO_DISABLE
bitfield.brief: Auto disable fast clear for depth

bitfield.name: COLOR_AUTO_DISABLE
bitfield.brief: Auto disable fast clear for color

stripe.name: YUV
stripe.doc: YUV tiler states
The YUV tiler can combine planar YUV formats to RGB or non-planar YUV formats.

stripe.name: TE
stripe.doc: TExture sampler states
Texture sampling, filtering, LOD, etc

stripe.name: NEW_TE
stripe.doc: New texture states
Extra texture states for newer hardware. These exist if chipMinorFeatures2 bit 11 set.

stripe.name: SH_INST_MEM
stripe.doc: Unified shader instruction memory
Shader instruction memory on new hardware that supports more than 256, or more than 1024 shader instructions (different areas are used based on these cases).

stripe.name: DUMMY
stripe.doc: Dummy state write, sometimes used for inserting padding or small delays into the command stream.
